lines.text: You don't know what you're getting into.
I know what I'm getting out of.
Harry is an artist without an art.
Well, that is something that could make a man very unhappy, Mary, groping for the right level, the means with which to express himself.
Yes, he is that. Is not he? I like that, Adam. It is a very nice thought.
Yes, but it can be dangerous.
Harry. Harry. You could have been anything. Anything. You had brains... ambition. You worked harder than any 10 men. But the wrong things. Always the wrong things...
Harry, do you know what you're doing? You're killing me. You're killing me and yourself.
Night and the city. The night is tonight, tomorrow night... or any night. The city is London.
If you ain't got socks you can't pull 'em up, can you?

[to Figler]
How much are you sellin' me for?

[Opening dialogue as she suddenly comes in and sees Harry going through her purse]
You won't find any money in there, Harry/
